Yoruba: Ẹ kú àyẹ́sí
English: Thank you for coming

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìnáwó
English: Happy celebration

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìkúnra
English: Compliment for carrying a pregnancy

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìgbúròó.
English: Compliment for hearing from distance relative.

Yoruba: A kú ọ̀rọ̀ ara wa
English: Compliment for looking out for each other

Yoruba: Ẹ kú àtẹ̀mọ́ra
English: Compliment for losing a beloved

Yoruba: Ẹ kú àṣẹ̀yìndè
English: Compliment for losing a beloved

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìdèlé
English: Compliment for losing a beloved

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìtọ́jú
English: Compliment for care giving

Yoruba: Ẹ kú etígbọ̀ọ́
English: Compliment for receiving good news

Yoruba: Ara ire yóò gbà á
English: Eat well

Yoruba: Ó dígbà
English: Goodbye/farewell

Yoruba: Ẹ ṣe é
English: Thank you

Yoruba: Ó dàárọ̀
English: Good night

Yoruba: Ó dábọ̀
English: Goodbye

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ọjọ́ ìbí
English: Happy birthday

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ọdún tuntun
English: Happy new year

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ọdún kérésì
English: Merry christmas

Yoruba: Ẹ pẹ̀lẹ́
English: Sorry

Yoruba: Ẹ má bìnú
English: Don’t be annoyed

Yoruba: Nítorí mi lẹ fi wá? ẹ kú àyẹ́sí mi.
English: You came because of me? Thank you for coming through for me.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú àyẹ́sí ọmọ mi.
English: Thank you for coming through for my child.

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ a lè lọ kí àwọn bàbá yẹn kú àyẹ́sí wa?
English: Can we go and greet father and thank him for coming through for us?

Yoruba: Kí ẹ rí i pé ẹ kì àwọn bàbá yẹn kú àyẹ́sí yín.
English: Make sure you greet that man for coming through for you.

Yoruba: Kání mo mọ̀, n ò bá ti kí wọn kú àyẹ́sí.
English: Had I know, I would have thanked them for coming.

Yoruba: Ìyá Ṣọlá, ẹ mà kú ìnáwó.
English: Ṣọlá’s mom, happy celebration.

Yoruba: Ọkọ ìyàwó àti ìyàwó ló yẹ kí o kí kú ìnáwó.
English: You should have greeted the groom and the bride a happy celebration.

Yoruba: Bàbá rẹ̀ mà kú ìnáwó.
English: A happy celebration to his father.

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ o ti kí wọn kú ìnáwó?
English: Have you greeted them a happy celebration?

Yoruba: Mo fẹ́ lọ kí bàbá mi pé wọ́n kú ìnáwó.
English: I want to go and greet father a happy celebration.

Yoruba: Ìya olóyún, ẹ kú ìkúnra o.
English: Pregnant woman, compliment for carrying a pregnancy.

Yoruba: O ti lóyún? O kú ìkúnra.
English: You are pregnant? Compliment for carrying a pregnancy.

Yoruba: Olúwa ṣeun, ẹ kú ìkúnra.
English: Thank God, compliment for carrying pregnancy.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìkúnra o, àsọ̀kalẹ̀ ayọ̀.
English: Compliment for carrying a pregnancy, safe delivery.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú oríire ìya Bùsáyọ̀, ẹ kú ìkúnra.
English: Congratulations Bùsáyọ̀’s mom, compliment for carrying a

Yoruba: Ẹ káàsán níbí o, ẹ sì kú ìgbúròó.
English: Good afternoon here and compliment for hearing from distance relative.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú àmójúbà, ẹ sì kú ìgbúròó.
English: Compliment for seeing your relative and compliment for hearing from distance relative.

Yoruba: Àwọn àna yín ti dé! Ẹ kú ìbúròó.
English: Your in-laws have arrived! Compliment for hearing from your distance relatives.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìgbúròó bàbá, ọmọ yín ti kọ̀wé ránṣẹ́.
English: Compliment for hearing from your distance relative father, your child has sent a letter.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìgburòó àwọn ará Ọ̀yọ́.
English: Compliment for hearing from your distance relative in Ọ̀yọ́

Yoruba: Ẹ jẹ jẹ́ ká kí ara wa kú ọrọ̀ ara wa.
English: We had better compliment ourselves for looking out for one another.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìdìde, a kú ọrọ̀ ara wa.
English: Thanks for coming and compliment for looking out for one another.

Yoruba: Ẹ ṣeun bàba Bọlá, a kú ọrọ̀ ara wa.
English: Thank you Bọlá’s father, compliment for looking out for one another.

Yoruba: Mo dúpẹ́ gidi gan lọ́wọ́ gbogbo yín, a kú ọrọ̀ ara wa.
English: I am very grateful to you all, compliment for looking out for one another.

Yoruba: Ẹ ṣeun tí ẹ ṣúgbà mi, a sì kú ọrọ̀ ara wa.
English: Thank you for coming through for me and compliment for looking out for one another.

Yoruba: A kú àtẹ̀mọ́rá ẹ̀yin ọmọ ẹgbẹ́!
English: Compliment for losing our beloved members!

Yoruba: Ẹ pẹ̀lẹ́, ẹ kú àtẹ̀mọ́ra.
English: Sorry, compliment for losing a beloved.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú àtẹ̀mọ́ra o, a ò ní rí irú ẹ̀ mọ́.
English: Compliment for losing a beloved, may we not witness such again.

Yoruba: Gbogbo ará ìlú ní kí a kíi yín kú àtẹ̀mọ́ra.
English: The whole community said we should compliment you for losing your beloved.

Yoruba: Ẹ̀yin la wá kí, ẹ kú àtẹ̀mọ́ra.
English: We are here to greet you, compliment for losing your beloved.

Yoruba: A kíi yín o, ẹ kú àṣẹ̀yìndè.
English: We greet you, compliment for losing your beloved.

Yoruba: Mo ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ gbọ́ ikú rẹ̀ ni, ẹ kú àṣẹ̀yìndè.
English: I just heard about his/her demise, compliment for losing your beloved.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú àṣẹ̀yìnde bàba yín.
English: Compliment for losing your beloved father.

Yoruba: Mo bá a yín kẹ́dùn, ẹ kú àṣẹ̀yìndè ìya yín.
English: I sympathise with you, compliment for losing your beloved mother.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú àṣẹ̀yìndè, ọdún ájínà síra.
English: Compliment for losing your beloved, may we live long.

Yoruba: Báwo ni Báyọ̀? ẹ kú ìdèlé bàba yín.
English: How are you Báyọ̀, compliment for losing your beloved father.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìdèlé, a ò ní rí irú rẹ̀ mọ́.
English: Compliment for losing your beloved, may we not witness such again.

Yoruba: Ẹ bá mi kí wọn kú ìdèlé.
English: Do compliment them for losing their beloved.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìdèlé o ẹ̀yin ẹbí, odún á jínà síra o.
English: Compliment for losing your beloved members of the family, may we live long.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìdèle ẹni ire tó fayé sílẹ̀.
English: Compliment for losing your beloved that departed this world.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìtọ́jú màmá, báwo lara wọ́n?
English: Compliment for care giving to mother, how is she fairing?

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìtọ́jú, ọlọ́run á mú wọn lára dá.
English: Compliment for care giving, may God heal him/her.

Yoruba: Ẹ ṣeun ìya agbẹ̀bí, ẹ kú ìtọ́jú.
English: Thank you midwife, compliment for care giving.

Yoruba: Ṣé ara ọkọ yín balẹ̀? Ẹ kú ìtọ́jú o.
English: Hope your husband is bettrr now? Compliment for care giving.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìtọ́jú ọmọ yín.
English: Compliment for care giving to your child.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú oríire, ẹ sì kú etígọ̀ọ́.
English: Congratulations and compliment for receiving good news.

Yoruba: Mo bá a yín yọ̀ o, ẹ kú etígbọ̀ọ́.
English: I rejoice with you, compliment for receiving good news

Yoruba: Ìròyin ayọ̀ leléyìí o, ẹ kú etígbọ̀ọ́.
English: This is a good news, compliment for receiving good news.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú etígọ̀ọ́ ìya Doyin.
English: Compliment for receiving good news Doyin’s mom

Yoruba: Ẹ kú etígbọ̀ọ́, ayọ̀ náà á kárí.
English: Compliment for receiving good news, may the joy go round.

Yoruba: Ẹ ti ń jẹun ìyẹn, ara ire yóò gbà á.
English: You are reating already, eat well.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ìgbádùn o, ara ire yóò gbà á.
English: Compliment for having fun, eat well.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú àpèjẹ o, ara ire yóò gbà á.
English: Compliment for having a feast, eat well.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú àsè, ara ire yóò gbà á.
English: Compliment for cooking, eat well.

Yoruba: Mo bá a yín re, ara ire yóò gbà á.
English: Just in time, eat well.

Yoruba: Ó dígbà o, ẹ ṣe jẹ́jẹ́ o.
English: Goodbye/farewell, be carefull.

Yoruba: A ti ń lọ o, ó dígbà o.
English: we are laving, goodbye/farewell.

Yoruba: Ó dígbà o, ẹ kí gbogbo ilé o.
English: goodbye/farewell, regards to family.

Yoruba: Ódígbà ẹ̀yin ọ̀rẹ́, à ó tùn máa ríra.
English: Goodbye/farewell friends, we shall meet again.

Yoruba: Ó dígbà o, kọ́lọ́hun má kọ àtúnrí wa.
English: Goodbye/farewell, may we meet again.

Yoruba: Mo dúpẹ́ gigi gan ni, ẹ ṣe é.
English: I am very grateful, thank you.

Yoruba: Ẹ ṣe é ìya Bùkúnmi, ẹ kú ìdìde.
English: Thank you Bùkúnmi’s mom, thanks for coming.

Yoruba: Ẹ ṣe é ẹ̀yin ará ìlú, ẹ kú àtìlẹyìn mi.
English: Thank you citizens, compliment for your support.

Yoruba: Bá mi kí wọn o, wọ́n ṣe é o.
English: Do extend my greetings to them, thanks to them.

Yoruba: Wọ́n ní pé ẹ ṣé o.
English: S/he said thank you.

Yoruba: Ó dàárọ̀ o, Ọlọ́hun a jíwa re.
English: Good night, see you tomorrow.

Yoruba: Ó dàárọ̀ ẹ̀yin ará, a ó ríra lọ́la.
English: Good night my people, we will meet tomorrow.

Yoruba: Mò ń lọ sùn, ó dàárọ̀.
English: I am going to bed, good night.

Yoruba: Ilẹ̀ ti ṣú, ó dàárọ̀.
English: It is late, good night.

Yoruba: Mò ń wọlé lọ sùn, ó dàárọ̀.
English: I am going inside to sleep, good night.

Yoruba: Ó dábọ̀ ẹ̀yin akẹ́kọ̀ọ́.
English: Goodbye students.

Yoruba: A tí lọ o, ó dábọ̀.
English: We are leaving, goodbye.

Yoruba: Ẹ má pẹ̀ o, ó dábọ̀.
English: Don’t stay long, goodbye.

Yoruba: Ó dábọ̀, ẹ tètè dé o.
English: Goodbye, do come back early.

Yoruba: A ti fẹ bọ́ sọ́nà, ó dábọ̀.
English: We will be on our way soon, goodbye.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú oríre òní, ẹ sì kú ọjọ́ ìbí.
English: Congratulations for today and happy birthday.

Yoruba: O kú ọjọ́ ìbí, ẹ̀mí rẹ ó ṣe púpọ̀ ọdún láyé.
English: Happy birthday, may you celebrate more years on earth.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ọjọ́ ìbí, ẹ ò ní fi ọdún yìí ṣe àṣemọ.
English: Happy birthday, may this year not be the last.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ọjọ́ ìbí bàbá Àjàní, ẹ ò ní kúkú òjijì.
English: Happy birthday Àjàní’s father, may you not die suddenly.

Yoruba: Bá mi kí Àyọ̀ká pé ó kú ọjọ́ ìbí.
English: Say me a happy birthday to Àyọ̀ká.

Yoruba: A kú ọdún tuntun o, ọ̀pọ rẹ̀ la ó ṣe láyé.
English: Happy New Year, may we celebrate more of it on earth.

Yoruba: A kú ọdún tuntun, màá ríi yín níwòyí ẹ̀míì.
English: Happy new year, I will see you next year.

Yoruba: A kú ọdún tuntun, àṣèyí ṣàmọ́dún.
English: Happy new year, may we celebrate this and many more.

Yoruba: A kú ọdún tuntun bàba Bọ́sẹ̀, ojú á máa rọ́dún.
English: Happy new year Bọ́sẹ̀’s father,  may we witness more years.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú oríire ẹ̀yin ará, a kú ọdún tuntun.
English: Congratulations people, happy new year.

Yoruba: Ẹ kú ọdún kérésì o, a ó ṣẹ̀míì.
English: Merry Christmas, may we celebrate another year.

Yoruba: A kú oríire, a dẹ̀ kú ọdún kérésì.
English: Congratulations and merry Christmas.

Yoruba: Bá mi kí bàbá pé wọ́n kú ọdún kérésì.
English: Say me a merry Christmas to father.

Yoruba: Ọdún yìí ò yẹ̀, ẹ kú ọdún kérésì.
English: This celebration is unshaken, merry Christmas.

Yoruba: Òní lọjọ́ ìbi Jésù, a kú ọdún kérésì.
English: Today is Jesus’ birthday, merry Christmas.

Yoruba: Ẹ pẹ̀lé, ṣé ẹ ò ṣèṣe?
English: Sorry, I hope you are not wounded?

Yoruba: Bá mi kí wọn pẹ̀lẹ́.
English: Say sorry to hin/her.

Yoruba: Ẹ pẹ̀lẹ́, ẹ sì kú ìtọ́jú.
English: Sorry and compliment for care giving.

Yoruba: Ẹ pẹ̀lẹ́, Ṣé ẹ ò ṣubú ṣá?
English: Sorry, I hope you didn’t fall?

Yoruba: Pẹ̀lẹ́ Bámiró, ṣé ará balẹ̀?
English: Sorry Bámiró, hope you are better?

Yoruba: Ó ṣééṣì ni, ẹ má bìnú.
English: It wasn’t intentional, don’t be annoyed.

Yoruba: Mo bẹ̀ yín, ẹ má bìnú sími.
English: I beg you, don’t be annoyed with me.

Yoruba: Bẹ̀ wọ́n kí o sì sọ fún wọ́n pé kí wọ́n má bìnú.
English: Beg him/her and tell him/her not to be annoyed.

Yoruba: Ìdọ̀bálẹ̀ ni mo wà, ẹ má bìnú.
English: I am lying down flat, don’t be annoyed.

Yoruba: Ẹ má bìnú sími, iṣẹ́ èṣù ni.
English: Don’t be annoyed with me, it’s the devils doing.
